alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 4:35PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact the I-90 Corridor from Bonner to Bearmouth through 530 PM MST... At 426 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers from Bonner to 10 miles northeast of Florence. Radar shows this band will move along the Interstate 90 corridor from Bonner to Bearmouth over the next hour. Some snow showers will reduce visibility to less than 1/2 mile for a brief period as these showers are moving east to southeast at 30-40 mph. In addition wind gusts up to 40 mph will occur with the stronger showers. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated and spotter reports. IMPACT...Gusty winds quickly reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Bonner-West Riverside, Nimrod, Clinton, Turah and Bearmouth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 109 and 147. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
